While I recognize the potential for the issues you raise, I have never seen
any of them in any of my JUnit experience (seven, maybe eight years now). I
use the parallel directory structure approach and never had a problem with
that either.

The biggest problem is getting programmers to write tests, followed by
getting them to write good tests that actually test all aspects of the code.

My 1/50th of a US Federal Reserve note.

Simon
(One of the JUnit mailing list moderators)
